column1: indian_feudal_desc;The event resulted in a collapse of the central government's authority in the Indian subcontinent. Nevertheless
column2: the remnants of the government managed to survive the event in isolated regions
column3: and soon became much more feudal in structure
column4: with ministers effectively having the power of monarchs. It is primarily focused around moving power upwards to the ducal
column5: kingly and imperial levels by treating the lowest of vassals in a manner more akin to regional governors than true feudal vassals. Compared to feudal states
column6: the ruler is somewhat restricted by the rule of law when dealing with their vassals.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: successor_desc;This character is one of the former generals and vassals of the Yunani conqueror of Rajasthan
column2: who died early in his reign.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: axe_of_devendra_desc;The famous axe of Devendra Purandar
column2: a neovedic ruler who raided almost all of Maharashtra.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: vajrayudha_desc;The weapon once said to be wielded by the god Indra himself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
rajasaurus_skull_desc;The skull of a demon named Rajasura
column2: slain by the gods in ancient times.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: varunastra_desc;A legendary weapon whose power comes from Varuna
column2: the god of the sea. It is said to be able to destroy any target using the power of the seas contained within it.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: agneyastra_desc;A mythical weapon whose power comes from Agni
column2: the god of fire. Legends say it can emit flames inextinguishable by normal means.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: suryastra_desc;An dazzling weapon said to be imbued with the power of Surya
column2: the god of the sun. It is decribed by some to be so bright that its light that would dispel any darkness.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: ghaznivinashakastra_desc;A powerful weapon used by the gods to slay the demon named Ghazni
column2: and save India from destruction.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: mansifid_desc;A mighty warrior and staunch defender of Islam
column2: he defeated the armies of three Hindu Kings at once
column3: saving Bengal from the heathen hordes.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: yunakshetra_bloodline_desc;A ruler descended from the prestigious Yukonama dynasty
column2: who re-conquered Yunakshetra.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
he managed to carve out a realm far bigger than that of the great yunani conqeror.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: purandara_bloodline_desc;A minor king who subjugated the warring states of Southern India and united the chaotic region under one massive empire.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
laskandar_bloodline_desc;The great yunani conqueror who established a realm stretching from Gujarat to the Indus River. He claimed descent from Ioannes Karasci himself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

gangaraja_bloodline_desc;The greatest ruler of the Sharma dynasty that once dominated north India. His reign is widely regarded as a golden age that brought stability and prosperity to the realm.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
british_invasion_desc;We can wage a war to bring the Indian lands under the Queen's authority;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
yama_conquest_desc;We can wage a war to establish an empire rivaling that of Lashkandra himself;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
unite_the_ganges_desc;Reform the ancient empire of the Sharma dynasty
column2: centred around the Ganges river.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: integrate_yunan_desc;The coastal regions of Maharashtra had been conquered by the Yunani of Mumbai centuries ago. However
column2: a strong Maharashtrian king can bring these regions back into the folds of the kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: form_madhya_pradesh_desc;Unite central India into one kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_himalayas_desc;Become the emperor of the mountains.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
expand_mughalstan_desc;It is said that the emperors of ancient Mughalstan ruled a realm stretching from the Indus in the west to Bengal in the east. By controlling these regions
column2: the newly-reestablished empire of Mughalstan can claim sovereignty over these lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: unite_the_ganges_TOOLTIP;Control all counties bordering the Ganges river;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_laskandar_empire_desc;Reunite the lands once conquered by Laskandar.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
form_laskandar_empire_tt;To be recognized as a true successor of Laskandar
column2: you must unite Rajasthan
column3: Gujarat and the Sindh under your rule before 2655. However
column4: if you were to conquer Punjab
column6: you shall be able to rule these regions as their lawful sovereign.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_cricket_game_start;The stadium has been prepared and the players have been summoned. It is time for the cricket match to begin!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA_cricket_game_start;I will cheer my team on from the stands!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_cricket_game_start;You know what? I'm going to join them on the pitch!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
TXT_EVTOPTB_cricket_game_start;You descend from the stands and join the game.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_win;After several long and brutal overs
column2: my team finally emerges victorious. As my section of the stands erupts into cheers
column3: I cannot help but join in.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_cricket_game_win;I knew I was right to support them!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_cricket_game_lose;After several long and brutal overs
column2: my team has been soundly defeated. As I hear the other section of the stands cheer in celebration
column3: I bury my head in my hands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: my team finally emerges victorious! My hips are bruised purple
column3: but the cheering from the stands makes the pain evaporate.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_cricket_game_personal_lose;Despite trying my absolute hardest to win
column2: my team has been soundly defeated. I collapse onto the floor
column3: holding my head in anguish
column4: as the crowd cheers for my opponents.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the ritual requires one final step. The captain of the other team murmurs a final prayer before being decapitated. His blood will serve as the ultimate offering to the Red King.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the ritual requires one final step. The captain of my team whispers an apology to his family before being decapitated. His blood will serve as a bitter offering to the Red King.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA_cricket_game_captain_sacrifice;A fitting conclusion to the game.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB_cricket_game_captain_sacrifice;It's a shame it had to turn out this way...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: and the attendees begin to return home. The people must surely have been pleased
column3: and it is thanks in large part to my own wealth and diligence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the protector of the world and preserver of Dharma.;;;;;;;;x
the three-eyed lord
column3: the destroyer

column1: old_hindu_DESC;Hinduism is a blanket term for a variety of related traditions and practices found in the Indian subcontinent
column2: with a history going back millenia before the event. Post-event hindus worship various dieties
column3: or 'Devas' out of which Vishnu
column6: and Shakti used to be prominent
column7: but local and minor gods have increased in importance over time
column8: and the goddess Lakshmi has seen an especial increase in importance. Gandhi began to be revered as a god
column9: while worship of Brahma was dropped altogether. Adherents of the faith hold that the event was caused by the god Kalki
column11: who destroyed the world because of its impious and decadent ways. The religion is based on a collection of religious scriptures known as a Vedas
column12: as well as various other post-vedic texts and a few post-event ones. They also believe that they reincarnate after death. A prominent aspect of the religion is adherence to the varna system
column13: where society is divided into four castes: The Brahmins (Priests)

column1: neovedic_DESC;A mysterious faith still not completely documented or understood by scholars of the subcontinent. Among other things
column2: neovedics believe that several aeons ago
column3: the evil lord of the Danavas
column5: was slain by Indra. Vritra's brother
column7: swore revenge on all the gods
column10: to destroy the earth which they held so dear. The first three were successfully killed by the devas
column12: the inhabitants of the world began to forget the devas and their rituals
column13: and began to worship false gods. Thus
column15: when the last Danava Kalki attacked
column16: the gods watched the world burn
column17: and did nothing to save it. To rectify humanity's great error
column18: the Neovedic faithful worship the old gods and perform rituals outlined in the Fifth Veda
column19: a collection of religious texts believed to be revealed by the gods themselves. Adherents of the faith show no hesitation in raiding or even invading realms of heathen rulers.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: maunaxite_DESC;Formed from a blend of native Indian tribal beliefs and a belief system that arrived to the subcontinent before the Event
column2: the Maunaxites have always been an insular group
column3: used to withstanding contempt and attacks from outsiders. The faith chiefly reveres Maushiva
column4: who inevitably rises up to destroy corrupt rulers. Other deities worshipped include Vishnu
column6: as in every other part of India
column8: the great Avatar of Vishnu. They principally believe that the event was caused by the rulers of the world growing too corrupt and thus Maushiva struck down the Proud mankind as punishment for his corrption.;;;;;;;;x

column1: maunaxite_reformed_DESC;Formed from a blend of native Indian tribal beliefs and a belief system that arrived to the subcontinent before the Event
column2: the Maunaxites have always been an insular group
column3: used to withstanding contempt and attacks from outsiders. The faith chiefly reveres Maushiva
column4: who inevitably rises up to destroy corrupt rulers. The faith has now been reformed
column5: adding a priestly hierarchy and formalised texts
column6: enabling it to more effectively resist the encroachment of other faiths. They principally believe that the event was caused by the rulers of the world growing too corrupt and thus Maushiva struck down the Proud mankind as punishment for his corrption.;;;;;;;;x

column1: neovedantic_DESC;Neo-Vedanticism is a hindu school of thought that advocates for the rejection of the varna system and abhors discrimination on the basis of social class. They consider themselves the successors of a pre-event movement
column2: while other dharmics think they emerged some time after the event. The word 'Neo-Vedantic' was originally used by their opponents to disparage them
column3: with the implication that they represented a break from tradition and hence were not authentically hindu. Neovedantics also differ in another crucial aspect: They consider Brahma
column4: Vishnu and Shiva as the three most important deities of hinduism (The Trimurti)
column5: while other devas are relegated to a more minor role. Kubera
column7: has been elevated in status by neovedantics
column8: and is widely worshipped by many of them.;;;;;;;;x

column1: parabrahmanist_DESC;The Parabrahmanist religion came to dominate many parts of India in the chaos following the Event. It is a highly dogmatic religion born out of hinduism
column2: focused on the belief that India
column3: is a holy land belonging only to the Hindu dieties. Like pre-event hindus
column5: but they view all gods as aspects of one
column7: it is from this distinctive idea that the sect gains their name. The Parabrahmanist deify what they believe to be great indian rulers of the ancient past
column8: such as the legendary King Bharata and Gandhi. They believe that at various points in history
column9: the Asuras sent many kings and their armies to destroy India
column12: and Angrezi. Each of them was stopped by various legendary rulers
column13: except for the final Asura king
column15: who almost managed to destroy the subcontinent
column16: and plunged it into an age of darkness. They call for the unification of all Indians under the aegis of a Parabrahmanist ruler
column17: to protect india from being annihilated by the next Asura. They are one of the most aggressive religions in their part of the world due to their zealotry in the defense of their indian holyland.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: form_indian_empire_desc;Unite the vast lands of India under your rule;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_rise_of_yama;Months of meticulous planning and politicking have finally paid off. You have finally managed to garner enough support to consider the possibility of a violent
column2: but quick usurpation of the Lashkandrian throne. The promised support has come in the form of a large contingent of soldiers
column3: waiting for your orders.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Ruler of the Punjab
column3: Subjugator of Gujarat
column8: Mahabasileya Yama! Within a few short decades
column9: not only have you remade Laskandar's shattered realm
column10: but managed to far surpass the conqueror and his empire in every possible way. You have managed to subjugate every realm west of the indus and east of the ganges
column11: and it is said that Hindu Rajas
column12: Bengali Sultans and Deccani Emperors alike regard you with fear and awe. Suffice it to say that you and your bloodline shall be immortalized in the history books.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: OPT_A_laskandar_restoration_kardi;Whoever wrote this needs a raise!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC_laskandar_restoration;In the grand scheme of things
column2: the Mumbaikar dynasty were nothing. A lowly patrician dynasty from Mumbai
column3: they claimed descent from Ioannes Karasci
column6: nobody believed them. But when little Lashkandra was born
column7: the dynasty would forever be etched into the history books in bold letters. His early life was shrouded in mystery
column8: but when he brought down the mighty kingdom of Rajasthan with a heavily outnumbered army
column9: the eyes of the entire subcontinent were on him. Gujarat
column12: kingdoms fell to his armies like dominoes. When he died
column15: as his son Laskandar was clearly too young to rule
column16: and the realm of the great conqueror shattered like glass. But now....now
column17: it is clear that Lashkandra still lives in the blood of his descendants.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: OPT_A_laskandar_restoration;The empire is united once more.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the forefathers of the Yunani people revolted against their pagan hindu overlords under the leadership of Ioannes Karasci
column3: and surprisingly
column5: conquering a realm that would come to be known as Yunakshetra
column6: homeland of the yunani people. After him
column7: various kings would come and go
column8: without managing to establish stable rule for their dynasty. Nothing lasts forever
column10: the realm collapsed into squabbling states. Isaakiya
column11: a minor ruler belonging to the Yukonama family
column12: managed to re-unify Yunakshetra and end the era of anarchy
column13: establishing the longest reigning yunani dynasty in history. Nothing lasts forever
column14: so the Yukonama dynasty fell to another pagan invasion
column15: leaving only a bastard son who fled to Gujarat. However
column16: his line has now managed to re-unite Yunakshetra
column17: proving to the world that the light of Yunakshetra still shines bright.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: OPT_A_yunakshetra_restoration;We can only hope that history does not repeat itself.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: Triumphant;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC_mumbai_triumphant;Ever since Yunakshetra was conquered by Yunaneshwar Desai
column2: Mumbai has remained the final bastion of the Yunani. The nobles that still remained after the war with the pagan king fled to the city
column3: and elected a new ruler to be their protector against further incursions. Partly due to its location in the middle of a major trade route
column4: the ruling class soon turned to more mercantile pursuits
column5: and Mumbai grew rich. Of course
column7: son of the conquering Yunaneshwar and a victor in a brief civil war
column8: thought that this wealth would be better off in his hands. The protector of Mumbai was out of options
column9: so he negotiated an annual tribute to the King in return for leaving them alone. But now
column10: everything has changed. Mumbai has come to rule the erstwhile lands of Yunakshetra
column11: and it can finally claim to be a worthy successor to the Yunani kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
